bug.short_desc: Improve the website API viewer by grouping the non-collection APIs together

long_desc.thetext:
This improvement is best explained when you e.g. take a look at the XHR API. To create a XHR instance the developer can use the API
q.io.xhr();
which will return a XHR instance. This API method is grouped under the "IO" package which is perfectly fine. However the methods of the XHR itself are listed on their own in the "XHR" package. Currently the only link between those two is a click at the return type of the method noted above.
Since these APIs are not grouped together and a developer uses the browser search it is hard to understand how these APIs are "working" together.
My proposal would be to group the instance methods directly below the q API method. These methods might also be displayed after a click at the additional icon / symbol. This would help to generate a single result for the browser search and the developer can dive into the instance methods in the right context. The linkage between the APIs would be much clearer.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
